Topic.Title: Someone is a phony.

Message.Msg: Really? Yourself in your fake imposter ID is always right? You are your own biggest fan in all your many IDs! It's all you live for: being a fraud, a fake, a con. I see a tiny typo causes your ID fail! Too funny. Always is. It's not the first time your emotions have outed your lies. I have an easy career, as a fully tenured professor, which grants me a few free moments to completely destroy you as a fake, a phony, a con and a self aggrandizing sham, yet you are too delusional to see it and come back for beating after public beating. You still pretend you have the skills to be a grammar queen when all I half to do is throw you a typo and say good dog, good dog. But you are not good. Just a dog. Now go fetch. I hope that helps.

Message.Title: Another Wonderful Fantastic Day In Philadelphia
Message.Msg: I am happy, yet nostalgic, when I gather my friends, family and students around me and recall what positive impact we've had on each other down through the wonderful years. Spring brings romantic thoughts. When I was young, before grad school, I took a hitchhiking trip across the US. Definitely a young man's game, and not for the mentally imbalanced, or those prone to long term daily board troll desk sitting. I hope that helps.

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: For someone with such low self esteem you sure are on an ego trip if you think my purpose here is somehow focused on you specifically. My focus, sweetie, is on BS. The meter went off the second you tried to imply you report *personal* use tax. You probably report it on your 'sham of a business' purchases but personal purchases? Your nose hit the monitor on that one. Speaking of your sham business...just from the little bits of 'accounting speak' you have vomited on this board over the years tells me you graduated at the bottom of your 'on-line university' class. I have seen you provide inaccurate information several time. Apparently anyone can get an "accounting" degree. Now go scam your poor naive, little old lady customers into thinking they can somehow avoid the AMT. Baaahaaaa. Loooooooser

Topic.Title: the ride is over knuckleheads, vote is happening today!!

Message.Msg: Couldn't agree with you more. It's eBay and diamond sellers, not mom&pop eBay sellers that will feel the pinch. Finally, the government is doing something right for a change and catering to mid-town America instead of thieving corporations.

Topic.Title: If amzn @ $270s, Ebay should be $80s (a third of amzn): Ebay making $2.50/year.

Message.Msg: Now we have both of you shark bait investors rallying !!! FYI, I'm not short on eBay, or long. I do business with eBay, which is why I would never invest in them until they get their act together and start doing business like they did several years ago before they started driving merchants and customers off the site.

Topic.Title: If amzn @ $270s, Ebay should be $80s (a third of amzn): Ebay making $2.50/year.

Message.Msg: I've said repeatedly, try selling something, anything on eBay and come back to tell me it was a positive experience. Call customer service, tell me it was a positive experience. AND just remember, my money goes to pay eBay fees which you investors are trying to take profit off. I actually have to do work...create listings, deal with customers, ship items while eBay takes the lion's share. Maybe if they were a little less greedy, a lot less pushy and actually valued "their customers", the stock would be similar valuation to Amazon.

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: They sure are. Once this bill passes, it will only be big business getting hit with taxes. Small merchants and mom&pop sellers making less than $1million per year in out-of-state sales will be exempt. Finally, our government is doing something right because if you're making a million dollars per year, you can damn well afford to pay more than your fair share.

Message.Title: When the Titanic Sank
Message.Msg: The rats were the first ones to abandon ship. The rich got off in lifeboats and the poor in steerage were left to die in freezing cold waters.
